channel.title: A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content on A Hugo website

item.title: Caregiver during childhood is associated with HIV test uptake among Chinese college students: A cross-sectional study in Suzhou, China
item.description: Poster presentation at the Annual Meeting of Society of Epidemiologic Research. Authors: Wanqi Wang, Zihan Dong, Hanrui Zhao, Stephen W. Pan Presenter: Wanqi Wang INTRODUCTION Due in part to growing acceptance of casual sex and limited sex education, many college students in China are increasingly vulnerable to HIV infection. Unfortunately, HIV testing rates among college students in China remain suboptimal. Previous studies indicate that caregiver during childhood may be associated with healthcare avoidance.

item.title: Muslim females and avoidance of health care services in China: a nationally representative cross-sectional study
item.description: Poster presentation at the Annual Meeting of Society of Epidemiologic Research. Authors:Stephen Pan, Wanqi Wang, Zihan Dong Presenter: Stephen W. Pan Background: Evidence suggests that Muslim minority females in the US have lower rates of healthcare utilization than the overall population, partly due to religious-based values of privacy and modesty, and healthcare services that lack Islamic cultural sensitivities. However, the relation between minority Muslim identity, sex, and healthcare utilization is poorly understood in China, despite a population of >20 million Muslims.

item.title: Religious involvement is associated with diabetes self-management among Chinese diabetes patients: a cross-sectional study
item.description: Oral presentation at the Annual Meeting of Society of Epidemiologic Research. Authors: Wanqi Wang, Shiqiang Wu, Yuxin Liang, Zihan Dong, Qikai Wang, Guofeng Zhou, Dan Mao, Yimei Tang, Stephen W. Pan Presenter: Wanqi Wang Background Diabetes prevalence is rising rapidly in China, but disease self-management among diabetes patients remains suboptimal. Research from Europe and the US indicates that religious involvement may be associated with more physical activity and healthy diet, but understanding of religious involvement among diabetes patient in China is limited.

item.title: Supernatural beliefs intervention to enhance type 2 diabetes self-management in China: a pilot randomized controlled trial
item.description: Oral presentation at the Annual Meeting of Society of Epidemiologic Research. Authors: Stephen W. Pan, Zihan Dong, Qikai Wang, Shiqiang Wu, Yuxin Liang, Wanqi Wang, Mark A. Strand, Amy Wachholtz, Guofeng Zhou, Dan Mao, Yimei Tang Presenter: Stephen W. Pan Background China has over 100 million people living with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), many of whom experience adverse health outcomes due to suboptimal diabetes self-management. Interventions framed around pre-existing personal beliefs in the supernatural may improve T2DM self-management, but such interventions are lacking in China.

item.title: Hygienic city study proposal (brief)
item.description: Motivation A city’s hygiene, which closely related to the local governance, can positively or negatively influence the health of citizens. The influence become especially prominent when we come to the infectious disease outbreak. The assessment of national hygienic city has a comprehensive guideline on solid waste management, waste water management, coverage of green area and green area per capital, Air Pollution Index (API) or Air Quality index (AQI) and other seven items.

item.title: Clinical notes: Health Disparities
item.description: People in low-socioeconomic status are at a high risk of diseases and death. I saw two patients both diagnosed with intracranial tuberculoma. One of them was a middle-aged and high-income man. He lived in a VIP ward for three months. He even wanted to live in the ward for several more days, after the doctors said that he is fully recovered. The other one is a 19-year-old rural boy, he came to city alone for a higher salary work.

item.title: An human experiment: How does pescetarian diet affect health
item.description: Introduction To evaluate the effect the health effect of pescetarian diet, an two-month’s intervention study was conducted on a 19-year-old female, from April, 6th to July 12th, in 2019. Food frequency questionnaire were answered by the participant at baseline. Blood glucose, hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c), blood urea nitrogen (BUN), high-density lipoprotein (HDL), low-density lipoprotein (LDL), height and body weight were measured at both baseline and follow-up. Limitations The sample size is only one, because the author fail to find more volunteer to participate in this study.

item.title: R visualization of Jilin Epidemic
item.description: load packages require(tidyverse) require(leaflet) require(leafletCN) if(require(rgeos)){ require(rgeos) } else{ install.packages(("rgeos")) } require(rgeos) require(maptools) New epicenter in China: Jilin, Jilin Where is Jilin in China? Sys.setlocale('LC_ALL', "Chinese") ## [1] "LC_COLLATE=Chinese (Simplified)_China.936;LC_CTYPE=Chinese (Simplified)_China.936;LC_MONETARY=Chinese (Simplified)_China.936;LC_NUMERIC=C;LC_TIME=Chinese (Simplified)_China.936" Due to a problem of leafletCN package, which cannot distingguish Jilin city and Jilin province (also Hainan city and Hainan province), it cannot use demomap() to demo the map of Jilin city or province (also Hainan), see in a open issue in [github repo] (https://github.

item.title: R visualization of epidemic in United States
item.description: Epidemic in United States On the another side of the world, however, the disease has rapidly transmitted through the world, especailly United States. As compare to China, it does not implement lockdown and social distancing policy at the early stage of the epidemic. But it’s true that, US’s mass screening and medical system performance has shown the its amazing health-care resources, which is shown in my previous assignment.

item.title: Clinical notes: a patients with lupus erythematosus
item.description: A 19-year-old, rural, skinny girl diagnosed with lupus erythematosus. Sometimes I met and talk with her in the ward. Some of our talking are very impressive to me, both reflect environmental and social issues. After I take notes on her symptoms, I still want to ask more things, even if I am not supposed to do. I am always interested in how does people get disease. The lupus erythematosus, why does this disease come to her.

item.title: Clinical notes: dementia caused by intracranial tuberculoma
item.description: Tuberculosis is not only a disease in respiratory systems, it can infect many organs, for example, osseous tuberculosis, Intra-abdominal Tuberculosis and central nervous system . I saw one case of intracranial tuberculoma during my observation in Dept.TB. The patient have kind of cognitive decline, and there is several seconds delay when he answer people’s questions, come to hospital because disability of one leg. Then he was diagnosed as intracranial tuberculosis with TB after CT and a series of serum test.

item.title: Clinical notes: A schizophrenia patient
item.description: One good-weather afternoon when I sit in the public office and read a medical book sleepily. There is a new patient just accepted by our department. It’s a patient with schizophrenia, with liver cirrhosis, and were sent to hospital by apsychia. Considering schizophrenia, he was put in a separate and isolated ward. I was just a student, and what I can do is only to go to ask patient’s history.

item.title: Clinical notes: blood donation and syphilis test
item.description: In the afternoon, the patients in the inpatient department are quiet and fall sleep. I usually go to the outpatient department, where I can talk and ask questions to the doctors when they are free. A doctor said that: “Many people got syphilis and are not be aware of that, but it’s not a problem. Because nowadays, people take antibiotics often, you know, even for a cold. Treponema pallidum is so easy to be killed.

item.title: Hello!
item.description: Hello! I am Green Ear Rabbit (My true name is Wanqi Wang. Because I have a rabbit and it like vegetables, I also like vegetables, vegetable is green). I am a student in China, and I am interested in epidemiology, clinical practice and statistical modeling. It’s really interesting and exciting to learn how to make a blog in school. If there is any problems or conflicts, feel free to contact me via: greenearrabbit@163.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a “hello world” example website for the blogdown package. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
